Kia America to recall about 85,000 US vehicles over seat back frame issue
data.description:
Feb 27 (Reuters) - Kia America is recalling 85,448 vehicles in the U.S. over failure of a seat back frame failing to properly restrain an occupant during a crash, the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Friday.

(Reporting by Preetika Parashuraman in Bengaluru; Editing by Mrigank Dhaniwala)

Block cuts over 4,000 jobs, with shares jumping 23%
data.description:
Block announced it will cut over 4,000 jobs, i.e. nearly half of its workforce, in a move that sent its shares up over 23% in after-hours trading. The group's workforce will be reduced from over 10,000 employees to just under 6,000, according to a letter to shareholders from co-founder and chief executive Jack Dorsey.

Management said that the restructuring is aimed at ushering in a new phase of long-term growth, with leaner teams and greater use of artificial intelligence to automate certain tasks. Chief financial officer Amrita Ahuja pointed to a shift in how the company operates as the business accelerates. The job cuts are expected to result in charges of between $450m and $500m, mainly recorded in Q1.

The announcement comes alongside quarterly results in line with expectations, with adjusted EPS of 65 cents on revenue of $6.25bn. Gross profit rose 24% y-o-y to $2.87bn. For the full year, Block forecast adjusted EPS of $3.66, above the $3.22 expected by the market.

data.title: India trade minister on U.S. 126% levy on Indian solar exports: anti-dumping or safeguarding duties typically not linked to trade deal
BDO Unibank, Inc. Reports Earnings Results for the Full Year Ended December 31, 2025
data.description:
BDO Unibank, Inc. reported earnings results for the full year ended December 31, 2025. For the full year, the company reported net income was PHP 87,174 million compared to PHP 82,019 million a year ago. Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was PHP 16.28 compared to PHP 15.34 a year ago.

Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was PHP 16.22 compared to PHP 15.3 a year ago.

data.title: Netflix Withdraws From Warner Bros. Discovery Bid as Paramount Skydance Offer Prevails
data.description:
Netflix has announced that it is withdrawing from the acquisition process for Warner Bros. Discovery's (WBD) studios and streaming operations, after the company's board judged a revised offer from Paramount Skydance to be superior. Paramount raised its proposal to $31 per share, all cash, for the entire group, compared with Netflix's $27.75-per-share targeted bid.

The new offer covers all of WBD, including its pay-TV channels such as CNN, TBS and TNT, and includes a $7bn break-up fee in the event of a regulatory block. Paramount has also committed to settle the $2.8bn owed by WBD to Netflix if their initial agreement were to collapse. Netflix had four business days to match the bid, but ultimately walked away, saying the required price would no longer make the deal financially attractive.

In after-hours trading, Netflix shares rose by nearly 10%, while WBD fell about 2%. Netflix executives said the negotiated deal would have created value with a clear path to regulatory approval, while stressing they had shown financial discipline. They thanked WBD management for what they described as a fair process, reiterating that the transaction was a strategic opportunity-not a necessity at any price.

data.title: Earendil Labs Enters Strategic Collaboration with Wuxi Xdc on Wuxitecan-2 Payload-Linker Technology Platform
data.description:
Earendil Labs announced a strategic collaboration with WuXi XDC Cayman Inc. on WuXi XDC's proprietary WuXiTecan-2 payload-linker technology platform. WuXi XDC Cayman Inc. is a globally recognized contract research, development, and manufacturing organization (CRDMO) specializing in bioconjugates. The company offers a wide range of innovative conjugation and payload-linker technologies to facilitate the development of next-generation antibody-drug conjugates (ADCs).

This collaboration marks the establishment of a robust strategic partnership aimed at accelerating the development of next-generation ADCs by synergistically combining Earendil Labs' cutting-edge AI-driven antibody discovery and development capabilities with WuXi XDC's globally leading ADC technology platform to address significant unmet medical needs. Under the agreement, WuXi XDC will grant Earendil Labs an exclusive global license to its proprietary WuXiTecan -2 payload-linker technology for use against multiple specific targets. Earendil Labs will utilize this technology to conjugate antibodies and bispecific antibodies discovered through its AI platform and to advance the development of the ADC candidates against these specific targets.

The total potential deal value could reach up to approximately $885 million, comprising an upfront payment, and certain development, regulatory, and sales milestone payments. Additionally, WuXi XDC will be eligible to receive tiered royalties on net sales upon commercialization of any resulting ADC products. Leveraging its world-leading integrated CRDMO platform, WuXi XDC will also fully support the Chemical, Manufacturing, and Controls (CMC) development and manufacturing of the ADC components within the collaboration.

Earendil Laboratories will focus on subsequent product development, global regulatory submissions, and commercialization. This complementary partnership ensures maximized resource utilization and efficient project progression.

data.title: PLDT evaluating options to optimize value from data center business
Dnb Bank Asa Announces Resignation of Olaug Svarva as Chair
data.description: DNB Bank ASA announced that current Chair of the Board, Olaug Svarva, will step down as Chair at the Annual General Meeting in April, after eight years in the position.

data.title: CoreWeave beats expectations but disappoints with quarterly outlook
data.description:
CoreWeave posted quarterly revenue that is above expectations, driven by strong demand for its cloud infrastructure dedicated to artificial intelligence. Q4  revenue reached $1.57bn, up 110% y-o-y and above the $1.55bn forecast, despite a loss of 89 cents per share. The stock nonetheless fell by up to 9.5% in after-hours trading.

Indeed, its Q1 outlook disappointed, with revenue expected between $1.9bn and $2bn, short of the market estimate of $2.29bn. For 2026, the group targets  revenue of $12bn to $13bn, with adjusted operating income of between $900m and $1.1bn. The order book reached $66.8bn, up from $55.6bn the previous quarter, while adjusted EBITDA came in at $898m, below the $929m expected.

CoreWeave plans to step up investment, with capex of between $30bn and $35bn in 2026, compared with $10.31bn in 2025. Active power capacity stood at 850 megawatts at the end of December, with 3.1 gigawatts under contract, and the target exceeds 1.7 gigawatts by the end of 2026. A provider of computing capacity for Google and OpenAI, the group reported debt of $21.37bn and increased its credit line to $2.5bn.

data.title: FI Raises Capital Requirements for Major Banks
data.description:
The Swedish Financial Supervisory Authority (Finansinspektionen) has increased its core Tier 1 capital ratio requirement (as a percentage of risk-weighted exposure amount, REA) for the three major Swedish banks – SEB, Swedbank, and Handelsbanken – as of the end of the fourth quarter.

For SEB, the requirement has been raised to 14.67 percent, compared to 14.66 percent in the previous quarter.

Swedbank's new requirement is 14.82 percent (previous quarter 14.81 percent), while Handelsbanken's stands at 14.82 percent, up from 14.72 percent in the third quarter.

Saint-Gobain Targets EBITDA Margin Above 15% in 2026
data.description:
For the past fiscal year, the group posted a net profit of 2.9 billion euros, up 1.4% compared to 2024. The operating margin remained stable at 11.4%, while free cash flow reached a robust level of 3.8 billion euros.

The group is also continuing its attractive shareholder return policy, with a proposed dividend of 2.30 euros per share for 2025, up 4.5%, and 402 million euros in net share buybacks carried out during the year.

Finally, the group announced it had achieved all the financial and strategic objectives set out in its "Grow & Impact" plan (2021-2025). For 2026, it is targeting an EBITDA margin above 15%, while warning that the first half will be impacted by extreme weather conditions in Europe and North America since the start of the year.

data.title: India seeks to cut power sector coal imports by 30% this year, sources say
data.description:
NEW DELHI, Feb 27 (Reuters) - India, the world's second-largest importer of thermal coal, wants to cut those imports for power plants by at least 30%, asking them to test increased blending with domestic coal, government and industry officials familiar with the plan said.

India's power plants used nearly 50 million tons of imported coal in 2025 from countries like Indonesia, South Africa and Russia. The government aims to cut this by at least 15 million tons this year, said two government officials and one industry source.

The South Asian country still relies on coal for three-fourths of its electricity generation, even as it ramps up renewable energy at a record pace toward its 2070 net-zero goal.

New Delhi wants to reduce reliance on imports for the country's nearly 17 gigawatts of power plants built to run on imported coal as government-backed Coal India and private miners have boosted domestic coal production.

Authorities aim to replace at least 20% of imported coal with domestic supply at most plants, with some able to go up to 30%, government and power company sources said.

The seven people Reuters spoke to did not want to be named as they were not authorised to talk to the media.

India's coal and power ministry did not respond to Reuters emails seeking comments.

The government has long sought to cut coal imports for the power sector, but those efforts have failed as power plants have been unable to burn lower-quality local coal.

An executive with a power plant in western Gujarat state said power plants won't be able to use as much domestic coal as the government wants without totally recalibrating their boilers, which would be very costly and require state subsidies.

However, the government has assured power producers that domestic coal supplies will be of high quality, one of the people involved in the testing said.

Coal India has been struggling with inventories of around 90 million tons as of December 31, after producing a record 781.1 million tons in the fiscal year to March 2025. That made up nearly 80% of India's total coal output last fiscal year.

To pare stockpiles, Coal India has opened up exports to Bangladesh, Bhutan and Sri Lanka.

India's thermal coal imports, second only to China, fell 6.2% in 2025, the steepest drop since 2021, as power demand declined in milder weather.

Despite plans to raise coal-fired capacity by 97 GW to 307 GW by 2034-2035, India's thermal coal imports are expected to slow gradually as newer coal plants are likely to come up in areas closer to domestic sources, said Rajiv Ramnarayan, chief executive of Singapore-based coal trader Equentia Natural Resources.

The share of imported thermal coal is expected to gradually shift from the power sector to non-power industries such as cement and sponge iron, said Vasudev Pamnani, director at iEnergy Natural Resources, a coal trader.

"Imports of lower and mid-calorific value coal are projected to decline gradually, offset by domestic supply, with imports limited to industries requiring specific qualities or higher-grade coal," Pamnani said.

(Reporting by Sethuraman NR; Editing by Mayank Bhardwaj and Sonali Paul)

By Sethuraman N R

Vishal Mega Mart Promoter Entity Reportedly Likely to Sell 6.5% Stake Via Block Deal
data.description:
Vishal Mega Mart Limited (NSEI:VMM)'s promoter entity Samayat Services LLP is expected to sell 6.5% stake in the company via a block deal. The shares are likely to be sold at a price of INR 115 apiece, which implies a 10% discount from 27 February 2026 closing price, according to ET Now report. Samayat Services held 54.09% (252.74 crore) in Vishal Mega Mart as of December 31, 2025 and under the stake sale, 30.5 million shares will be offloaded, the report said.

Shares of Vishal Mega Mart on 27 February 2026 ended at INR 127.53 on the NSE, up by INR 4.56 or 3.71% from the February 25, 2026 closing price. The stock on 27 February 2026 traded amid strong volumes with over 40 million shares changing hands. Vishal Mega Mart shares have surged 24% over a one year period, which is an outperformance over Nifty's 13% and BSE Sensex's 10% in the same period.
